data.description: Introduction to a special topic in African literature, focused on a specific region or genre.
data.title: INTRODUCTORY TOPICS IN AFRICAN LITERATURE

data.description: Overview on Arabic cultural production. Develops a historic and critical understanding of Arabic literary traditions, as well as related musical and visual arts, up to the twenty-first century.
data.title: INTRODUCTION TO ARABIC LITERARY CULTURE

data.description: Provides a conceptual focus for the study of various forms of literature from around the African world. Literary forms studied may include novels, drama, poetry, short stories, cinema, and more. Depending on the conceptual focus, texts from a particular region, period, or language may be stressed, or they will coalesce around certain themes, such as modernity, cultural identity, nation building, ideology, globalization, and more.
data.title: TOPICS IN AFRICAN LITERATURE

data.description: Survey of African literary traditions and introduction to literary analysis.
data.title: INTRODUCTION TO AFRICAN LITERATURE

data.description: The oral tradition and the written word; the composition of stories, relationship between performer and audience, and transmission of tradition in various African societies.
data.title: THE AFRICAN STORYTELLER
